meanings.definition: The right-hand side of a ship or aircraft when facing forward.
meanings.sent1: The captain stood on the starboard side of the ship.
meanings.sent2: The crew members gathered on the starboard to watch the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The seagull landed on the starboard and tried to steal a fish from the deck.
meanings.sent4: The starboard of the ship was bathed in golden sunlight as it sailed into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The starboard was painted with a bright red stripe for safety.

meanings.definition: To turn a ship or aircraft to the right.
meanings.sent1: The captain decided to starboard the ship to avoid the storm.
meanings.sent2: The pilot had to starboard the plane to align with the runway.
meanings.sent3: The ship began to starboard slowly, making the passengers sway slightly.
meanings.sent4: The aircraft had to starboard sharply to avoid a collision with another plane.
meanings.sent5: The captain shouted, 'Starboard!' as he turned the wheel to the right.
